items.name: Compute: Subscriber DDL Migration Pipeline
items.description: Build the missing Step 6 of generateCubeSchemas.js — the subscriber DDL migration pipeline. This is the safety mechanism that generates SQL scripts (003/004 files) to keep the analytics warehouse schema in sync when models change. Without this, any schema change on CRM source will silently break replication or cause data loss. Scope: CRM MVP. Claude implements, you review/verify.

items.name: Create modelSnapshot.js — load/save snapshot utility
items.description: Claude creates src/utils/analytics/modelSnapshot.js with two functions: loadModelSnapshot({ msSlug, paths }) — reads {analytics-cube}/.snapshots/{msSlug}.snapshot.json and returns parsed model array (or null if first run). saveModelSnapshot({ models, msSlug, paths }) — writes current models to snapshot file with microserviceSlug, generatedAt timestamp, and models array (each with name, tableName, fields[{name, dataType, isRequired}]). Follow the snapshot format defined in CUBEJS_MASTER_PLAN.md lines 666-681. Ensure .snapshots/ directory is created if missing.

items.name: Create diffSchemaChanges.js — schema diff engine
items.description: Claude creates src/utils/analytics/diffSchemaChanges.js implementing the diffSchemaChanges({ previousModels, currentModels, msSlug }) function per master plan lines 687-745. Must detect: CREATE_TABLE (new model), DROP_TABLE (removed model), ADD_COLUMN (new field), DROP_COLUMN (removed field), ALTER_COLUMN_TYPE (type change — compare dataType). Also detect RENAME_COLUMN by matching on position/type when a field disappears and a new one appears with same type in same model. Return structured change objects with { type, model, field, msSlug, previousType, fieldName }.

items.name: Create classifyChange function for additive/destructive/blocked
items.description: Claude adds to diffSchemaChanges.js: classifyChange(change) that maps change types to categories per master plan lines 797-813. ADD_COLUMN/ADD_TABLE → 'additive'. DROP_COLUMN/DROP_TABLE/ALTER_COLUMN_TYPE_SAFE → 'destructive'. RENAME_COLUMN/RENAME_TABLE/ALTER_COLUMN_TYPE_UNSAFE → 'blocked'. For type changes, need a safe/unsafe cast matrix. Reference the existing migrationRiskClassification.js type compatibility matrix.

items.name: Create generateSubscriberMigration function
items.description: Claude creates the core migration generation logic in src/utils/analytics/subscriberMigration.js. Given classified changes, generate: (1) 003_subscriber_migration.sql — additive changes only. (2) 003_subscriber_migration.verify.sql — verification queries. (3) 004_destructive_changes.sql — destructive changes with WARNING comments. (4) 004_destructive_changes.WARNING.md — human-readable impact explanation. For blocked changes: log error with guided migration path, do NOT generate SQL.

items.name: Create generatePreDestructiveScript for NOT NULL columns
items.description: Claude adds logic to detect when a DROP_COLUMN targets a NOT NULL field (field.isRequired === true). Generate 004a_pre_destructive.sql containing ALTER TABLE ... ALTER COLUMN ... DROP NOT NULL. This must run on the subscriber BEFORE the source migration drops the column, per Decision 36.

items.name: Create subscriber_migration.sql.template
items.description: Claude creates src/computeConstructors/replication/subscriber_migration.sql.template. Wrapper template for 003 files: header comment with generation timestamp and microservice name, BEGIN transaction, placeholder for ALTER TABLE statements, ALTER SUBSCRIPTION REFRESH PUBLICATION (for new tables), COMMIT.

items.name: Wire Step 6 (CUBE_SUBSCRIBER_DDL) into generateCubeSchemas.js
items.description: Claude adds Step 6 after existing Step 5 in generateCubeSchemas.js. Per master plan lines 1534-1550: call loadModelSnapshot, call diffSchemaChanges, if changes exist call generateSubscriberMigration, then call saveModelSnapshot. Handle first-run case: when no snapshot exists, generate initial 003 with full CREATE TABLE statements for all models.

items.name: Update index.js exports in utils/analytics/
items.description: Claude updates src/utils/analytics/index.js to re-export from the new diffSchemaChanges.js, modelSnapshot.js, and subscriberMigration.js files.

items.name: Write unit tests for diffSchemaChanges, classifyChange, and migration generation
items.description: Claude creates test files. Test cases: (1) No previous snapshot → all CREATE_TABLE. (2) New field → ADD_COLUMN. (3) Field removed → DROP_COLUMN. (4) New model → CREATE_TABLE. (5) Model removed → DROP_TABLE. (6) Safe type change → destructive. (7) Unsafe type change → blocked. (8) Rename detected → blocked. (9) classifyChange categories. (10) 003/004/004a SQL output correctness. (11) NOT NULL pre-step generation. (12) Verify SQL generation.

items.name: Review and verify migration pipeline with CRM-V3 models
items.description: You trigger generateCubeSchemas for CRM-V3 twice: first run (no snapshot) should produce initial 003. Then modify a model and run again. Verify: snapshot saved correctly, diff detects changes, 003/004/004a files generated correctly, blocked changes logged. Claude fixes any issues found during your review.

items.name: Compute: Dashboard Controller & Schema Refactoring
items.description: The Prisma schema has cubeName/measureName/dimensionName fields (Phase 1 done), but the Joi validation schemas and controllers still reference the OLD fields (modelId, fieldId, aggregationType). Claude refactors all 3 dashboard entity controllers + schemas to match. You review diffs.

items.name: Refactor dashboardMetric schema + controller to use cubeName/measureName
items.description: Claude updates dashboardMetric.schemas.js (remove modelId/aggregationType/aggregateFieldId/groupByFieldId/whereConditions/queryJoins, add cubeName + measureName) AND dashboardMetric.controller.js (remove model/field existence validations, update Prisma calls, update response shape). Both files in one pass.

items.name: Refactor dashboardFilter schema + controller to use cubeName/dimensionName
items.description: Claude updates dashboardFilter.schemas.js (remove modelId/fieldId, add cubeName + dimensionName) AND dashboardFilter.controller.js (remove model/field validations, update Prisma calls). Both files in one pass.

items.name: Refactor dashboardWidget schema + controller — metricId required
items.description: Claude updates dashboardWidget.schemas.js (remove model/field refs if present, make metricId required) AND dashboardWidget.controller.js (remove model/field includes, ensure metricId validation). Both files in one pass.

items.name: Update dashboard controller tests
items.description: Claude updates test files for dashboardMetric, dashboardFilter, dashboardWidget. Replace old field references in test payloads with new ones. Add test cases for cubeName validation.

items.name: Review all refactored files and run tests
items.description: You review the diffs across all changed files. Run the test suite. Claude fixes any failing tests or review feedback.

items.name: Compute: First CRM-V3 Cube Generation Test Run
items.description: Run the full Compute generation pipeline for CRM-V3 with generateCubeSchemasFlag=true to produce actual cube schemas in the analytics-cube repo. This proves the backend works end-to-end. Must be done after the subscriber DDL pipeline is built. You drive the API call and verify output, Claude fixes issues.

items.name: Configure env vars and trigger CRM-V3 cube generation
items.description: You set ANALYTICS_CUBE_GIT_URL, ANALYTICS_CUBE_REPO_BRANCH on Compute dev instance. POST /api/v1/analytics/microservices/:crmV3Id/generate-cube-schemas. Verify: core/ and domain/ cube files created, replication scripts generated, snapshot saved, changes pushed to analytics-cube repo. Claude troubleshoots if generation fails.

parent_task.name: Compute: First CRM-V3 Cube Generation Test Run

items.name: Review generated cube schemas and SQL for correctness
items.description: You and Claude review 3-5 generated core cube files. Verify: correct table references, client_id filter, measures for numeric fields, dimensions, time dimensions, FIELD_TYPE_TO_CUBE_TYPE mappings. Domain files use extends pattern. Dry-run 003_subscriber_migration.sql against analytics DB to validate syntax. Claude fixes any template issues.

parent_task.name: Compute: First CRM-V3 Cube Generation Test Run

items.name: Data Warehouse: CRM Replication Setup (MVP)
items.description: Set up PostgreSQL logical replication from CRM-V3 source DB to the analytics warehouse DB. Scope: CRM only (44 tables). Prerequisite: analytics-cube-db pod must be running in dev namespace. You execute DB commands, Claude provides the SQL and troubleshoots.

items.name: Enable wal_level=logical on CRM-V3 source DB
items.description: You check current wal_level on CRM-V3 dev DB with `SHOW wal_level;`. If not 'logical', update postgresql.conf and restart. Brief CRM DB downtime on dev.

items.name: Seed CRM-V3 schema on analytics warehouse DB
items.description: You run CRM-V3's Prisma migrations against the analytics warehouse DB to create the crm-v3 schema and all 44 tables. The subscriber DB needs table structures BEFORE subscription. Verify with: SELECT table_name FROM information_schema.tables WHERE table_schema = 'crm-v3';

items.name: Review pub.sql, update sub.sql, apply both
items.description: Claude reviews pub.sql against current CRM-V3 Prisma schema (verify 44 tables are correct, no internal tables included). Claude updates sub.sql with correct credentials and FQDN host. You apply pub.sql on CRM-V3 source DB, then sub.sql on analytics warehouse DB. Verify publication/subscription created correctly.

items.name: Verify CRM replication end-to-end
items.description: You check pg_stat_subscription (all tables 'r' state), compare row counts for key tables (Company, Person, Opportunity), INSERT a test row on source and verify it appears on subscriber. Claude provides all verification queries.

items.name: Document replication runbook for CRM
items.description: Claude writes the CRM replication runbook in data-warehouse-db/README.md: commands used, monitoring queries, recovery procedures (skip record vs full resync), the 'disable auto-migration' K8s change. You review for accuracy.
